Bernie Sanders Gabrielle Giffords and other victims were being treated. At a time when our discourse has become so sharply polarized- at a time when we are far too eager to lay the blame for all that ails the world at the feet of those who happen to think differently than we do- it's important for us to pause for a moment and make sure that we're talking with each other in a way that heals, not in a way that wounds, he said. More than any one politician, Sarah Palin , the 2008 Republican vice presidential candidate and a possible John McCain House contender in 2012, figured in the unfolding political debate. They show that Saddam Hussein tried to work out a last-minute peace deal with the help of former Soviet leader Mikhail Gorbachev , while at the same time remaining defiant and referring to George H.W. Bush as the enemy of God and humanity. The documents were released by the National Defense University in Washington. Along with George H.W. Bush , the reunion will include former Dan Quayle , then-Defense Dick Cheney , former Joint Chiefs of Staff Chairman Colin Powell and others.

It took exactly one night for Michael Vick 's name to be once again embroiled in controversy. Michael Vick 's Virginia-based lawyer Lawrence Woodward denied reports that his client spent his first night of freedom at a Virginia Beach strip club. It is absolutely, categorically false, Lawrence Woodward said. Groups and singers as young as 12 years can audition for the series, which will premiere in the fall. Unlike ''American Idol,'' ''The X Factor'' does not have an upper age limit. I like the idea that a 12-year-old on this show can compete with an older singer and a singing group, said Simon Cowell , the former ''American Idol'' who will be a judge and an executive producer on ''The X Factor.'' ''I've never believed there should be a cut-off age for talent.''

Our country should not be a country where the super rich get to play by different rules than people who are working their way up to their own American dream. Sen. Bernie Sanders said he was happy to see the Republicans decided to stand behind Ryan after months of offering vague talk of deep government cuts.

Press MUNCIE, Ind.-- U.S. Rep. Mike Pence discussed his political future-- in somewhat nonspecific terms-- while addressing students in a Central High School social studies class Friday. Mike Pence acknowledged he was considering maybe coming home and running for governor, but the Republican said he was likely months away from making a final decision. He didn't completely rule out seeking a seventh term representing Indiana's 6th District in the U.S. House. While it's

impression. Photograph: David Cheskin/Empics No end of coverage in today's papers about Sky Sports presenters Richard Keys and Andy Coulson Gray's sexist jibes at the weekend. Here's a sample. Gray: Why is there a female linesman? Sombody's fucked up big. Kay: ''The game's gone mad. See charming Karren Brady this morning complaining about sexism? Yeah. Do me a favour love.'' Alan Partridge couldn't have put it any better. Except- strange
